**Robusta Configuration Tutorial**

- To configure robusta, the Robusta CLI is required.

	`pip install -U robusta-cli --no-cache`

- Generate a Robusta configuration.

	` robusta gen-config`

- A generated_values.yaml, will be created. This is your Helm values.yaml file

	`generated_values.yaml`

	```
		globalConfig:
	  signing_key: e8cbddd7-3230-4bc9-8887-0d2b960e3f89
	  account_id: e2f958f2-ad49-4a86-8edf-59963f0f7644
	sinksConfig:
	- robusta_sink:
	    name: robusta_ui_sink
	    token: 
	- discord_sink:
	    name: beagle_discord_sink
	    url: https://discord.com/api/webhooks/1077854611832053841/SwuZ9vXg0bp5tGixMEaelCjVKD8c95wJkhkkyPPdNwTeO981s897LbuPLI3R09UUk34I
	enablePrometheusStack: true
	enablePlatformPlaybooks: true
	runner:
	  sendAdditionalTelemetry: false
	rsa:
	  private: 
	  public: 
	```


- Add Robusta's chart repository:

	` helm repo add robusta https://robusta-charts.storage.googleapis.com && helm repo update`

- Specify your cluster's name and install Robusta using Helm

	`helm install robusta robusta/robusta -f ./generated_values.yaml --set clusterName=beagle-stage-tc -n beagle-tc`


- Verify the two Robusta pods and running with no errors in the logs:

	`kubectl get pods -A -w | grep robusta `
